Then-Secretary of State Colin Powell afforded a clue when he said in May 2002, How important it was for me to have this unified body of opinion and thought behind me in working for peace. In other words, the President Bush administration formed the Quartet to insulate itself from blame for diplomatic failure and unilateralism.
